metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5842 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The html_context_handle_element function in gst/subparse/samiparse.c in gst-plugins-base in GStreamer before 1.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) via a crafted SMI file, as demonstrated by OneNote_Manager.smi.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-base-1.0 - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu2.1
gstreamer1.0-alsa - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu2.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu2.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base-apps - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu2.1
gstreamer1.0-x - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu2.1
libgstreamer-plugins-base1.0-0 - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-base1.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-1~ubuntu2.1').
